icontrol.drivers

Class RS232_Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.RS232_Driver

  • public class RS232_Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    "Driver" class to support RS232 communication in Instrument Control (iC).

    To convert between String and byte[] use the UTF-8 character set, for instance String.getBytes(Charset.forName("UTF-8"))

    How to use the RS232_Driver class:
    Instantiate this class and call OpenPort. To send/receive data use Send and Receive. Don't forget to call ClosePort to close the port after use.

    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

    • Method Detail

      • OpenPort

        public void OpenPort(java.lang.String ComPortName,
                     int BaudRate,
                     int DataBits,
                     int StopBits,
                     java.lang.String Parity)
              throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Opens the specified serial port using the specified parameters for baud rate, number of data and stop bits, and parity.
        Parameters:
        ComPortName - The name of the RS232 port, for instance 'COM1'.
        BaudRate - The baud rate for RS232 communication. For GPIB communication this parameter is ignored.
        DataBits - The number of data bits for RS232 communication. For GPIB communication this parameter is ignored.
        StopBits - The number of stop bits for RS232 communication. For GPIB communication this parameter is ignored.
        Parity - The parity for RS232 communication. Can be 'none', 'even', 'odd', or 'mark' (case insensitive). For GPIB communication this parameter is ignored.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - when the specified COM port 1) was already opened and, hence, cannot be opened again, or 2) could not be opened for some (unspecified) reason, or 3) if the specified COM port was not found on the system, 4) if the in-out streams could not be assigned, or an IOException was thrown from configRS232 because the specified serial port parameters could not be set.

      • getBaudRate

        public int getBaudRate()
        Returns the Baud rate of the serial port.
        Returns:
        The actual baud rate or 0 if the port was not opened before.

      • ClosePort

        public void ClosePort()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the serial port.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When closing the in/out streams caused an error.

      • Send

        protected void Send(byte[] Message)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the given byte[] via the RS232 port (and flushes the output stream to make sure the data is sent). Returns immediately if Message is empty. After sending the data to the output stream, this method waits the time it takes theoretically to send the data. This is to ensure that the data could have been received before the program proceeds (and attempts to read).

        Parameters:
        Message - The data bytes to be sent.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an IO error occurred during sending to the output stream. This should actually not occur.

      • Receive

        protected byte[] Receive()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads from the serial port until no more data was received for a specified time out value. Because serial transmission can be rather slow, it is assumed that this method can be called before the receive buffer is entirely filled. Therefore, the receive buffer is repeatedly read until no data was received within the time out value defined in the iC_Properties.

        Note: In theory one could end transmission upon receiving a end-of-transmission character, but because, in general, the data stream can contain any character including this eot-character this is not recommended.

        Returns:
        The data bytes received from the RS232
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurred during reading the input stream. This should actually not occur.

      • configRS232

        protected void configRS232(int BaudRate,
                           int NrDataBits,
                           int NrStopBits,
                           java.lang.String Parity)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Configures the Baud rate, number of data and stop bits and the parity of the RS232 port. Use the constants defined in SerialPort<\code>
        Parameters:
        BaudRate - The available Baud rates depend on the driver. If an unsupported baud rate is specified, an IOException<\code> is thrown.
        NrDataBits - The number of data bits; can be 5, 6, 7, or 8
        NrStopBits - The number of stop bits; can be 1, 2, or 3 (for 1.5 stop bits)
        Parity - The parity for the check of a successful transmission; can be 'none', 'even', 'odd', or 'mark' (case insensitive).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the specified parameters are not supported by the RS232 driver.

      • ByteBufferToLogString

        public static java.lang.String ByteBufferToLogString(java.nio.ByteBuffer Message)
        Convenience method to convert the content of a ByteBuffer to a String with each Byte's hexadecimal value. The String is used for logging purposes, and it includes a preamble.
        Parameters:
        Message - The ByteBuffer to convert. The position of the "iterator" is changed.
        Returns:
        The String with the hexadecimal values of msg with preceding "0x "
